author: mr_elton_19
content:
Hey guys, I was wondering if a long-range fork rule like in Mina ( https://medium.com/@haresh.gedia/mina-protocol-beginners-guide-to-ouroboros-samasika-consensus-protocol-2-448e5247b15d ) could remove the need for weak subjectity checkpoints in Ethereum ? 

The rule is: When presented with 2 or more different forks, pick the one with the highest density ( nr. of blocks per epoch ) as that is the one least likely to be a product of long-range attack.
